report_title: Adjustable Bed & Mattress Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. Adjustable bed and mattress manufacturers are experiencing a decrease in the current period due to various factors. One primary reason is the economic downturn that has resulted from the global COVID-19 pandemic. The pandemic has caused widespread disruptions in supply chains, retail operations and consumer spending patterns. As people face financial uncertainties and prioritize essential expenses, demand for nonessential items like adjustable beds and mattresses has declined. This decrease in consumer demand has led to a drop in production and sales within the industry. Furthermore, the pandemic-related restrictions have affected the housing market, causing a slowdown in homebuying activities, which directly impacts demand for bedroom furniture, including adjustable beds and mattresses. Overall, industry revenue is expected to fall at a CAGR of 2.9% to $1.9 billion going into 2023, including a 0.6% decrease in 2023 alone. Despite the current decrease in the industry, there are signs of stabilization in terms of profit. Manufacturers in the industry have been working towards optimizing their production processes, reducing costs and improving operational efficiency. By implementing lean manufacturing practices, streamlining supply chain operations and investing in automation, companies have been able to achieve cost savings and enhance profitability. Profit is expected to be 3.2% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Adjustable bed and mattress manufacturers' revenue has fallen at a CAGR of 2.9% to $1.9 billion, including a 0.6% decrease in 2023, when profit will reach 3.2%.

The industry is facing supply chain disruptions due to the pandemic, causing interruptions in global supply chains affecting raw material availability, production capabilities, and ability to meet customer demand.
The slowdown in the housing market and consumer uncertainty due to economic downturn has impacted demand for bedroom furniture like adjustable beds and mattresses.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Revenue is expected to grow at a CAGR of 2.0% to $2.2 billion, including a 1.6% increase in 2028, when profit will reach 3.0%.
There is a growing emphasis on the importance of sleep health and overall well-being, driving demand for adjustable beds and mattresses that offer customizable comfort features.

The industry is witnessing significant advancements in technology, with manufacturers incorporating smart features like programmable settings, sensors, and connectivity options into adjustable beds and mattresses.
The growth of e-commerce and direct-to-consumer sales channels has opened new avenues for the industry to reach consumers directly and offer competitive prices.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures adjustable beds and mattresses for retailers, wholesalers, consumers and the export market. This industry specifically excludes hospital beds.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Specialty bedding stores play a crucial role in the industry. These stores focus primarily on selling specialized bedding products, including adjustable beds and mattresses. They typically have a wide range of options available to cater to different customer needs and preferences.

Furniture stores also contribute significantly to the market for adjustable beds and mattresses. Many furniture stores offer a diverse range of home furnishings, including bedroom furniture sets, which often include adjustable beds and compatible mattresses.

General retail stores such as Macy's and Bloomingdales are meant to serve as a one-stop shop for consumers and therefore tend to have high foot traffic, which is often an issue for bed and furniture stores. Moreover, general retail stores often have a different business model from other retailers, offering a reduced selection of mattresses at lower prices.

Included in the sector are hotels, motels, and other hospitality companies such as resorts. Hotels typically purchase mattresses and bases within their own price range. Thus, high-end hotels are the most likely to purchase industry products relative to motels and budget hotels.

products_and_services.product_description: Adjustable bases are motorized bed frames that allow users to adjust the position of the head, foot, or both, offering personalized comfort and support. These bases typically come with remote controls or smartphone apps for easy adjustment.

Adjustable mattresses are designed to provide customized comfort and support by allowing users to change the position and elevation of different areas of the mattress. They often feature multiple zones that can be adjusted independently, catering to individual preferences and targeted support for specific body parts.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Since the timing of a new mattress purchase is at the consumer's discretion, most individuals wait until they feel comfortable making a big purchase. This is especially true of adjustable beds and mattresses because they are typically more expensive than traditional mattresses. So disposable income is a key determinant of demand for industry products.

Adjustable mattress purchases are also determined by price, since most consumers are price-conscious. The industry's products are expensive; therefore, consumers are often willing to shop at multiple stores for the best available price.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The current period is characterized by economic challenges, such as a recession or a decline in consumer spending. During economic downturns, consumers tend to reduce discretionary spending on nonessential items, including adjustable beds and mattresses. This decrease in consumer demand can lead to a decline in both domestic and international sales, resulting in reduced exports and imports.

The global supply chain disruptions, which have been particularly prevalent during the COVID-19 pandemic, have had a significant impact on exports and imports in the industry. Delays in production, transportation, and delivery of goods can hamper the ability of manufacturers to meet export demands.

As the economy improves and consumer confidence returns, there is likely to be a rebound in consumer spending, including on discretionary items like adjustable beds and mattresses. Rising incomes and improved financial conditions can drive demand for these products, leading to an increase in both domestic and international sales.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is home to several manufacturing clusters that specialize in furniture production, including adjustable beds and mattresses. States like North Carolina, Georgia, and Mississippi have a strong presence of furniture manufacturers and suppliers. These clusters provide a favorable environment for the growth and development of the industry in the region.

The West region, particularly in states like California, is known for its vibrant innovation and technology ecosystem. This emphasis on technological advancements and innovation extends to the furniture industry, including the production of adjustable beds and mattresses. Manufacturers in the region leverage cutting-edge technologies and design techniques to create innovative and high-quality products.

regulations_points.regulation_description: All occupational, safety and health rules must be followed by businesses and this necessitates that all equipment be continuously inspected, modified, and adjusted so it can adapt to and satisfy any ensuing changes in standards for its usage or operation.

In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, health and safety regulations were implemented in 2020. According to these recommendations, establishments should maintain additional cleanliness measures and temporarily distance themselves from one another.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases make up the largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The cost of products sold, which includes the cost of major inputs such wire coils, foam, plastic, steel, and fabric, is the industry's highest expense. Due to rising steel and oil costs, raw materials have grown more expensive, consequently impacting the cost of foam and wire springs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Skilled labor is required for the design and assembly of each mattress
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Each mattress must be designed and assembled by skilled workers, and this is especially true for the industry's highly specialized mattresses and bed bases.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Consumers are more likely to purchase an item if the product name is recognizable
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Customers are more inclined to buy a product if they are familiar with the brand name. Given this, businesses in the industry market advertise their goods to build their brand recognition in a congested market.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The manufacturing of adjustable beds and mattresses displays a low level of capital investment.
The necessity for manpower is due to the manual labor involved in mattress assembly.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The industry has exhibited high level of revenue volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue volatility in the industry is largely caused by the relatively young age of the industry combined with changes in disposable income, the strength of the domestic economy and residential construction levels.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The introduction of smart beds is anticipated to cause disruption for those working in the industry.
